meanings.definition: A small, low island or reef.
meanings.sent1: The sailors spotted a tiny cay in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The cay was covered in lush green vegetation.
meanings.sent3: The little cay looked like a floating garden.
meanings.sent4: The cay was a speck of land in the vast ocean.
meanings.sent5: The cay shimmered under the bright sun.

meanings.definition: A pile of stones, often used as a boundary marker.
meanings.sent1: They built a cay of rocks to mark the edge of the property.
meanings.sent2: The ancient cay of stones stood for centuries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids rearranged the cay of rocks into a smiley face.
meanings.sent4: The cay of stones guarded the entrance to the forest.
meanings.sent5: The cay of rocks glowed in the moonlight.
meanings.sent6: Next to the river, there was a cay of stones marking the boundary.
meanings.sent7: The old cay of rocks had weathered many storms.
meanings.sent8: The cay of stones was a silent witness to history.

meanings.definition: To pile up stones to form a boundary marker.
meanings.sent1: They decided to cay the perimeter of the garden for a rustic look.
meanings.sent2: The children helped cay the path with colorful pebbles.
meanings.sent3: He began to cay the border of the flower bed with precision.
meanings.sent4: She carefully cayed the rocks to create a neat boundary.
meanings.sent5: The villagers gathered to cay the sacred circle for the ceremony.
